verses.verse: (A Song of Ascents, of David.) O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> my <S%H3820>heart<s%> is not <S%H1361>proud,<s%> <S%H3808>nor<s%> my <S%H5869>eyes<s%> <S%H7311>haughty;<s%> <S%H3808>Nor<s%> do I <S%H1980>involve<s%> myself in <S%H1419>great<s%> matters, Or in <S%H6381>things<s%> <S%H4480>too<s%> <S%H6381>difficult<s%> for me.

<S%H518>Surely<s%> <S%H3808><s%> I have <S%H9586>composed<s%> and <S%H1826>quieted<s%> my <S%H5315>soul;<s%> Like a <S%H1580>weaned<s%> child [rests] <S%H5921>against<s%> his <S%H517>mother,<s%> My <S%H5315>soul<s%> is like a <S%H1580>weaned<s%> child <S%H5921>within<s%> me.
O <S%H3478>Israel,<s%> <S%H3176>hope<s%> in the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> From <S%H6258>this<s%> <S%H6258>time<s%> forth and <S%H5704>forever.<s%> <S%H5769><s%>
